thread.title: Exclusive: The millionaire landlord raking in thousands each week from dangerously-overcrowded houses
thread.title_full: Exclusive: The millionaire landlord raking in thousands each week from dangerously-overcrowded houses

title: Exclusive: The millionaire landlord raking in thousands each week from dangerously-overcrowded houses
text: Exclusive: The millionaire landlord raking in thousands each week from dangerously-overcrowded houses Independent.ie A BUSINESSMAN who owns a number of houses being rented by up to 40 people at a time claims he is doing nothing wrong, remarking: "There is nothing unusual about this... sure what happens when you have 40 kids in a school?" http://www.independent.ie/irish-news/news/exclusive-the-millionaire-landlord-raking-in-thousands-each-week-from-dangerouslyovercrowded-houses-35411930.html http://www.independent.ie/incoming/article35426732.ece/87654/AUTOCROP/h342/landlord.jpg Businessman Jim Cuddy, and bunk beds in the overcrowded house in Rathmines that are visible from the roadside. Photo: Damien Eagers Bunk beds in the overcrowded house in Rathmines are visible from the roadside Photo: Damien Eagers The house in Rathmines had up to 40 women living there. It has been described as a 'death trap' Jim Cuddy The houses on the Howth Road A BUSINESSMAN who owns a number of houses being rented by up to 40 people at a time claims he is doing nothing wrong, remarking: "There is nothing unusual about this... sure what happens when you have 40 kids in a school?"
